text:
"Blinding Lights" by the Weeknd is the most-streamed song on Spotify, with over 3.9 billion streams.

The following lists contain the most-streamed songs and albums as well as charts records on the audio streaming platform Spotify.

As of November 2023, "Blinding Lights" (2019) by Canadian singer the Weeknd is the most-streamed song of all time on Spotify, while "Dance Monkey" (2019) by Australian singer-songwriter Tones and I is the most-streamed song by a female artist. English-Albanian singer Dua Lipa has the most songs in the top 100 for a female artist with five entries. The oldest song in the top 100 is Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody" (1975).

There are nine songs known to have claimed the top ranking, starting with "Viva la Vida" by British rock band Coldplay in 2008. Spotify's most-streamed song for the longest period of time was "Shape of You" (2017) by English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran.

As of November 2023, over 500 songs have surpassed one billion streams on Spotify,[1] 47 have surpassed two billion, and four have surpassed three billion in the platform's history.

Most-streamed songs [ edit ]

On this chart, songs are ranked by cumulative streams since their release.

Weekly number-one songs [ edit ]

Key # Indicates current number-one song ‡ Indicates number-one Spotify song of the year[142]

"Flowers" by Miley Cyrus is the song that received the most streams in its period at the top of Spotify.

Annual top five most-streamed songs [ edit ]

Drake has topped the annual most-streamed songs list a record two times.

10 most-streamed albums [ edit ]

As of November 2023, Un Verano Sin Ti by Puerto Rican rapper Bad Bunny is the most-streamed album of all time on Spotify, while Dua Lipa by English-Albanian singer Dua Lipa is the most-streamed album by a female artist.

The following table lists the top 10 most-streamed albums on Spotify, with streams rounded to the nearest million, as well as the number of tracks, the artist and the date it was released.
